Here is the fix for long file name: Please put the downloaded files on the top level folder (C: or D:). If you put it on deeper levels, it will raise the error message because the file/folder name are too long!

Suggestion:  
would it be possible to break up the mass of books by group (general category)?  that way we can download the group that most interests us, and not the whole library.   the reason for my suggestion is I am seeing many downloaders got the whole 4.7 GB only to find out the file is corrupt, or they are stuck at 99.9%... this would be a more efficient use of seeders and downloaders bandwidth, and increase chances of getting a complete set in the topic of interest.  Maybe split it into 700MB groups, would have the added benefit that some can also burn onto CD.

Nero doesn't care for the long folder names (with all the punctuation) - depending on the version. When the names (path depth) gets too long it hangs in the middle of the burn with no error messages. 

Roxio Easy Media Creator didn't have any problems with them using UDF102 file system.
